metadata.Title: CVE-2021-29625 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.Description: Adminer is open-source database management software. A cross-site scriptingvulnerability in Adminer versions 4.6.1 to 4.8.0 affects users of MySQL,MariaDB, PgSQL and SQLite. XSS is in most cases prevented by strict CSP inall modern browsers. The only exception is when Adminer is using a `pdo_`extension to communicate with the database (it is used if the nativeextensions are not enabled). In browsers without CSP, Adminer versions4.6.1 to 4.8.0 are affected. The vulnerability is patched in version 4.8.1.As workarounds, one can use a browser supporting strict CSP or enable thenative PHP extensions (e.g. `mysqli`) or disable displaying PHP errors(`display_errors`).

criterions.comment: adminer package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
